poem:
### An Island Watches

On the map, Cyprus waits,  
a pebble in a dark pond,  
watching ripples of distant strife.  
Across the blue divide,  
small boats scarred with time's marks,  
cling to lines of latitude,  
seeking the shade of its olive groves,  
while the island listens  
to whispered myths of crumbling empires  
carried on Mediterranean winds.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Top adviser to Iranian supreme leader dies in hospital after Israeli attack, Iranian media reports – live 6.56pm BST In Cyprus, the European Union’s nearest member state to the Middle East, authorities have activated an emergency evacuation plan that, as in previous crises, has seen the strategic island become a hub for third world nationals fleeing conflict in the region. With all eyes on the island’s British sovereign base areas – a legacy of colonial". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
